description_html:
Three partners have come together to develop a series of lights that offer intelligence and simplicity—Richard Meier, the Pritzker-Prize winning architect, Ana Meier, a product designer with a strong modernist voice, and Hervé Descottes, a lighting master. The timeless yet forward thinking collection represents a shared ideology from all three designers.

Developed using primarily Corian and a range of materials including aluminum, steel, and hand blown Venetian glass, the collection consists of sculptural sconces as well a variety of product types including globe pendants, floor lamps, and table lamps.

“With this collection, we aim to bring the power of architecture to a smaller-scale. I was moved to take recurring themes and forms in Richard’s work, and translate them into sculptural objects that are interacted with everyday.” -Ana Meier

“These pieces provide a new experience of space, where the user carefully controls the interplay of form and shadow. The designs reveal a dialogue between geometries at different scales, while retaining the precision so distinctive of Richard’s cannon of work.“ -Hervé Descottes

“Architecture has the power to inspire, to elevate the spirit, to feed both the mind and the body. With this collection, we have distilled this feeling into objects...” –Richard Meier
